intro: Pilosella brachiata subsp. babaemontis, commonly known as the Babaymont's hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in alpine and rocky habitats, often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
